result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Michelle L. VANDEGRIFT
Current: 1216 N. 11th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 05-25-2016)
Prior: 507 N. 4th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

The State moves to dismis and read in.  The defendant plead to a charge of PTC burglary in case no: 15 CF 195.  Motion granted.
Minutes.
Plea date on May 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Ann Larson to JLF
Plea date on April 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Settlement Conference Summary.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Settlement Conference with D.A. set for 03-24-2016 at 9:15 a.m.
Change of telephone number filed by the defendant.
It is hereby ordered for the reasons stated on the record on October 8, 2015 that bail is set at $750.00 cash with same conditions previously set.

ADDRESS INFO for Michelle L. VANDEGRIFT
Current: 507 N. 4th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 10-16-2015)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

$750.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody at 9:00 a.m.
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-29-2015 at 3:20 a.m.  Plea date is set for 02-17-2016 at 3:00 p.m.  
BAIL MODIFICATION HEARING
Counsel argue. Court modifies bail to $750.00 cash with the same conditions of no contact with Alexander M. Novak and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail Issued. 
Minutes.
Ann Larson, public defender.

Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.
Cover letter.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-08-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-28-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with Alexander Novak and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
RE: Bail jumping, on 09-21-15.
